tasks: Create a user persona for an e-commerce website using the 10 Usability Heuristics from nngroup.com. Document 3 pain points and 2 goals for your target audience.
Redesign the navigation menu of a fictional website using the 8-point grid system. Ensure it's accessible and easy to use.
Conduct 1 user interview and document 3 pain points related to UI Craft & Visual Design using the Zeigarnik Effect as a reference. Analyze how the design elements contribute to user frustration.
Create a mood board for a hypothetical product launch, incorporating Occam's Razor principles to minimize visual noise.
Develop a user research plan for a new feature using the Laws of UX. Identify 5 potential research questions and outline a method for data collection.
Redesign the error messages for a fictional website, applying the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to create a more user-friendly experience.
Create an interactive prototype of a hypothetical product using InVision or Figma. Ensure it incorporates best practices from both UI Craft & Visual Design and User Research & Validation.
Write a case study for your redesign efforts, highlighting the user research process and how it informed your design decisions.

resources.readup: As a Practitioner UX designer, you have the potential to transform user experiences and drive business success. Focus on building your skills in User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication to elevate your practice and make a meaningful impact.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Mastering Usability Heuristics
topics.summary: Develop a deep understanding of usability heuristics to inform design decisions and improve user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing products using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design and identify areas for improvement
Create a comprehensive heuristic evaluation checklist with clear criteria and scoring system

topics.name: Applying Cognitive Biases in UX Design
topics.summary: Understand how cognitive biases affect user behavior and design decisions to create more intuitive and effective interfaces.
practice_points: Conduct 3 usability testing sessions using the Zeigarnik Effect and Miller's Law to identify cognitive biases in user behavior

topics.name: Developing a User-Centered Design Process
topics.summary: Create a structured design process that incorporates user research, validation, and iteration to deliver high-quality user experiences.
practice_points: Map out the user journey for 2 existing products using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and identify pain points
